page.title: 06INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: One villager gave us this interesting account of the history of the Churches of Pennington.There have been three churches in Pennington.The first was a Chapel of Ease to Milford.It was called Magdalen Chapel.The earliest mention of it is in the year 1276,about the time when Henry of Thistleden was Lord of the Manor.The site of this early church is not known but "Priestlands" was the Glebe on which the Priest-in-charge lived.The church passed out of use in the reign of Queen Elizabeth 1,and no trace of the ruins can now be found.After this Pennington was without a church until 1837,when it became a separate,Ecclesiastical District and a small church called St.Mark's was built on the present site.As the village grew the church became too small.
